title: Open Source Data Visualization Project deck.gl v9 Released
blurb: A major milestone in terms of modernizing the deck.gl ecosystem.

title: Introducing kepler.gl 3.0
blurb: An major and long awaited update to the leading open geospatial applicaton for the web.

title: Visualizing Success: Year One of the OpenVis Collaboration Space
blurb: An overview of the extensive progress in the deck.gl ecosystem since joining the OpenJS foundation.

title: OpenJS Open Visualization Collaborator Summit - Madrid
blurb: The first Open Visualization summit brought visualization experts from all over the world to Madrid.

title: OpenJS World 2022: OpenJS Foundation Welcomes Urban Computing Foundation, vis.gl and kepler.gl
blurb: deck.gl and the vis.gl frameworks suite has been accepted into the OpenJS foundation.

title: deck.gl 8.2 moves to Open Governance
blurb: deck.gl and the vis.gl frameworks suite is now under open governance through the Linux Foundation and the Urban Cumputing Foundation.

title: pydeck: Unlocking deck.gl for use in Python
blurb: The power of deck.gl is now available to Python and Jupyter notebooks.

title: Exploring Geospatial Data with kepler.gl
blurb: A showcase of how kepler.gl helps leverage the power of the vis.gl frameworks for geospatial analytics.

title: Vis Hackathon 2019
blurb: A range of visualization projects using the vis.gl frameworks and beyond.

title: Kepler.gl: Export Map
blurb: kepler.gl now supports exporting maps for use on the web.

title: Introducing kepler.gl for Jupyter
blurb: kepler.gl can now be controlled from Jupyter notebooks.

title: Uber’s vis.gl brings glTF to geospatial data visualization
blurb: The Khronos glTF format brings high-quality models and pysically-based rendering to the vis.gl frameworks.

title: Using deck.gl with Google Maps
blurb: deck.gl now provides a new module enabling deck.gl to be used with Google basemaps.

title: Introducing deck.gl v7.0
blurb: deck.gl v7 brings a slew of new layers, lighting support, binary data support and more.

title: Kepler.gl + Dropbox = Map Save & Share
blurb: kepler.gl now provides integration with cloud storage enabling maps to be saved.

title: How (sometimes) assuming the Earth is “flat” helps speed up rendering in deck.gl
blurb: An deep-dive into the new optimized geospatial projection engine in deck.gl v6.2

title: GPU Accelerated Aggregation in deck.gl
blurb: deck.gl v6.2 moves aggregation related computation to the GPU.

title: deck.gl and Mapbox GL JS: Better Together
blurb: The deck.gl and Mapbox teams have collaborated on deep WebGL integration enabling new use cases when using deck.gl with Mapbox basemaps.

title: Mapping the Parisian trees
blurb: Showcase of how to work with a dataset in kepler.gl.

title: Visualizing Unemployment for U.S. Counties with kepler.gl
blurb: Showcase of how to work with a specific dataset in kepler.gl.

title: Using Kepler.gl and Movement to Visualize Traffic Effects of a Rainstorm
blurb: Showcase of how to work with a specific dataset in kepler.gl.

title: Animating 40 years of California Earthquakes
blurb: Showcase of how to work with a specific dataset in kepler.gl.

title: Start Scripting with deck.gl
blurb: deck.gl can now be used directly from HTML scripts without the use of npm packages.

title: Automatic, GPU-based object highlighting in deck.gl Layers
blurb: Highligting the selected object in a layer is now handled by deck.gl directly on the GPU.

title: Unfolding the Earth: Myriahedral Projections In WebGL
blurb: A visual exploration of alternaive mathematical approaches to flatten the Earth sphere.

title: Introducing luma.gl v4.0
blurb: A summary of luma.gl improvements and early roadmaps.

title: Wind Map
blurb: A showcase of using deck.gl for particle animations and vector field visualizations.

title: Rendering A Minecraft World With deck.gl
blurb: An alternate use case for deck.gl.

title: The Birth of a Visualization Framework Suite
blurb: vis.gl is a new suite of frameworks centered around deck.gl focused on big geospatial data visualization.

title: Introducing deck.gl v4.0
blurb: The second major public release of deck.gl brings a wide range of improvements.
